title: Lend Lease Bouygues JV subcontracts UGL for Australia’s NorthConnex project
text:
Lend Lease Bouygues JV subcontracts UGL for Australia’s NorthConnex project 10 September 2015 Print Email 
UGL and Lend Lease Bouygues joint venture (LLBJV) have signed a four-year alliance agreement for Australia's NorthConnex Project. 
Earlier this year, LLBJV received a $3bn contract from the transport operator Transurban to design and build a 9km twin-tube tunnel for the NorthConnex project in Sydney. 
The $476m alliance agreement covers the design, procurement, construction and commissioning of the mechanical, electrical, control, fire and communication systems required for the motorway. "It will result in greater freight efficiency and the easing of traffic congestion in north-western Sydney." 
Talking about the NorthConnex project, UGL CEO Ross Taylor said: "It will result in greater freight efficiency and the easing of traffic congestion in north-western Sydney." 
NorthConnex is a joint initiative between the New South Wales and federal governments, Transurban and the M7 Westlink shareholders to build, operate and maintain a tolled motorway linking the M1 Pacific Highway at Wahroonga to the Hills M2 Motorway at Pennant Hills Road. 
The 9km tunnel motorway includes interchanges to the north and south to accommodate connections at either end of the project. 
Up on completion, the tunnel will link Sydney's north to the Orbital network and form part of the National Highway route. 
The project is also expected to reduce the passage of 5,000 trucks daily on the Pennant Hills Road, while enabling car drivers to avoid 20 sets of traffic lights and reduce up to 15min from their journey times. 
Construction of the NorthConnex Motorway began in February, and the motorway is anticipated to be opened to public in 2019. Follow Us:
